column4: is there a software for mounting all drives on startup (fstab) without using the terminal or a text editor?
/etc/fstab is the location for it.
use this command --> sudo apt-get install pastebinit && cat /etc/fstab | pastebinit
that command was cool
i know :-) works nearly always.
AFTER the lines, not in front
/dev/scd0       /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 user,noauto,exec,utf8 0       0 ... can i tuse the "0    0" drom that row and copy it?
all you have to do is add 0 <space > 0 at the end of each line.
a second :-)
jst a second. Can you do this for me? -->
of course
sudo aptitude install pastebinit && dmesg > log && cat log | pastebinit && rm log
and give that link to me here?
uh wait .... change aptitude into apt-get
http://pastebin.com/f2a83f8ab
are the discs mounted?
after your command i shoud restart?
no .. it only gave me a log of what happens / went wrong when you started ur computer ... but nothing about the discs ...
i'm not sure what can be wrong ... perhaps that ActionParsnip has an idea :-)
nosuid ... change to "user" ??
haven't had enough experience with fstab to say that for sure ...
